thread.title: Jets WR Brandon Marshall runs in Rock 'n' Roll half marathon
thread.title_full: Jets WR Brandon Marshall runs in Rock 'n' Roll half marathon

author: SETH WALDER
title: Jets WR Brandon Marshall runs in Rock 'n' Roll half marathon
text:
Jets WR Brandon Marshall heads toward the Brooklyn finish line in style on Saturday. 
Brandon Marshall is apparently staying in shape during the bye week. 
The Jets wide receiver was spotted running the Brooklyn Rock ’n’ Roll Half Marathon on Saturday. Marshall was seen about 100 feet from the finish line on the west side of Prospect Park, wearing a fedora as he ran. The race announced that the star wideout was approaching the finish line right before he got there. 
Marshall tweeted that he was running the race for his non-profit organization Project 375 and dedicating each mile of the race to a different mental illness. Marshall announced in 2011 that he had been diagnosed with Borderline Personality Disorder. Bryn Lennon/Getty Images Brandon Marshall and the Jets are on a bye week after beating the Dolphins in London last week. 
The idea of the Rock ’n’ Roll Half Marathon is that live bands encourage participants with music throughout the course. 
The Jets are currently on their bye week after a hot 3-1 start to the season. Marshall, acquired during the offseason in a trade with the Bears, has been a big part of the early-season success, having caught 30 passes for 400 yards and three touchdowns this season. We dedicate each mile of the #RnRBrooklyn to those w/ #mentalillness . Please help by donating $15 or more: http://t.co/QCU7BHxi5q #IAmAware — Machine Marshall (@BMarshall) October 10, 2015 Related Stories
